sources.name: Smithsonian National Museum of Asian Art

artifacts.title: Stamp Seal of Ur
artifacts.summary: Chlorite seal used to authenticate barley ledgers for the temple granary.
artifacts.caption: Chlorite seal impressed onto clay tablets to certify deliveries from Ur's canal estates.

artifacts.title: Maritime Silk Textile
artifacts.summary: Brocaded silk fragment showing double-phoenix trade stamp from the Ming maritime bureau.
artifacts.caption: Stamped silk coupon issued to approve export cargo on the South China Sea junks.

artifacts.title: Benin Court Brass
artifacts.summary: Lost-wax brass plaque showing Iyoba Idia flanked by retainers.
artifacts.caption: Royal plaque documenting coral regalia allowances for the Iyoba court.

artifacts.title: Transatlantic Trade Beads
artifacts.summary: Venetian glass beads recovered from ballast on the Thames foreshore.
artifacts.caption: Ledger-tagged Venetian beads destined for Gold Coast forts.

artifacts.title: Andean Quipu Fragment
artifacts.summary: Dyed camelid fiber cords holding census values for ayllu households.
artifacts.caption: Knot cluster recording llama tribute owed after the Cusco harvest.

artifacts.title: Arctic Survey Log
artifacts.summary: Field diary from Gu√∞mundsson sled survey across Jakobshavn Glacier.
artifacts.caption: Graphite logbook noting ice thickness and magnetometer drift.

artifacts.title: Freedom School Negatives
artifacts.summary: 35mm film documenting the Freedom Summer literacy drive.
artifacts.caption: Contact sheets annotated by SNCC photo lab interns.

artifacts.title: Aurora Telegraph plate
artifacts.summary: Glass plate negative capturing auroral curtains during the Carnegie expedition.
artifacts.caption: Spectrograph trace annotated to calibrate telegraph blackout warnings.
